title: Asking for Directions
description: Learn how to ask for and understand directions in Portuguese, navigate the city, and find your way around.

vocabulary.example: Qual é o nome da rua?
Onde fica a estação de metro?

grammar.title: Using 'Ficar' for Location
grammar.content: The verb 'ficar' means 'to be located' or 'to stay'. It's the most common way to ask where something is located.
examples: Onde fica o museu? (Where is the museum?)
O hotel fica perto da praia. (The hotel is near the beach.)
A farmácia fica na esquina. (The pharmacy is on the corner.)

grammar.title: Prepositions of Location
grammar.content: Common prepositions: em (in/at/on), à (to the), de (from/of), perto de (near), longe de (far from), ao lado de (next to).
examples: ao lado do banco (next to the bank)
em frente à igreja (in front of the church)

grammar.title: Polite Commands (Imperative)
grammar.content: Use the imperative form to give directions politely: Vire (turn), Siga (continue), Atravesse (cross).

exercises.question: How do you ask 'Where is the station?'
exercises.explanation: 'Onde fica a estação?' means 'Where is the station located?'

exercises.question: How do you say 'Turn right'?
exercises.explanation: 'Vire à direita' means 'Turn right'. 'Vire' is the imperative form.

exercises.question: What does 'em frente' mean?
exercises.explanation: 'Em frente' means 'straight ahead' or 'in front'. Very common in directions.

exercises.question: Complete: É ____ daqui? (Is it far from here?)
exercises.explanation: 'Longe' means 'far'. 'É longe daqui?' = 'Is it far from here?'

exercises.question: What is 'paragem' in European Portuguese?
exercises.explanation: 'Paragem' means bus stop in European Portuguese. In Brazil, it's 'ponto de ônibus'.

culturalNotes.title: Portuguese Streets and Addresses
culturalNotes.content: Portuguese addresses list the street name, number, floor (andar), and side (esquerdo/direito). Example: Rua Augusta, 123, 2º andar direito (Augusta Street, 123, 2nd floor right).

culturalNotes.title: Asking for Help
culturalNotes.content: Portuguese people are generally very helpful with directions. Start with 'Desculpe' (Excuse me) and most people will gladly assist, even if your Portuguese isn't perfect.

culturalNotes.title: Metro vs Autocarro
culturalNotes.content: In Lisbon and Porto, 'metro' is the subway system. 'Autocarro' is the bus. In Brazil, they say 'ônibus' for bus. Taxis and Uber are widely available in cities.
